results.title: Handle with care: glass
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Indian glass industry, contrasting the products of the individual artisan and the modern streamlined factory. To aid the industry, the Government established the Central Glass and ceramic Research Institute in Calcutta to conduct research into new types of glass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Half of mankind
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, United Nations and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film deals with community development in Asia. The village is the unit of organization on which Asia rests, and it is the basis of community development. Three examples are shown: simple self-help in Cambodia; villages cooperating with the World Health Organization to run a health clinic in Afghanistan; interdependence of the agricultural and industrial communities in India, with cash crops providing capital for agricultural development and mechanized expansion of village crafts with the aid of electricity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir, United Nations and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: Ozala
results.brief_description:
“Ozala” is an Afghani refugee who spent three years in a detention centre - his only crime was in wanting freedom. During this time in prison Ozala discovered the art of painting, where he could express his emotions, where shapes and colors became symbolic of his life and experiences and where he could escape to freedom. A thoughtful and reflective film interspersed with images of Ozala’s paintings.
In Farsi (Persian) with English subtitles

results.title: Paranoid
results.brief_description: Year nine students Dexy and Sam are already auteurs in the suburban shlock/horror genre. In this thilling chase through the streets of Melbourne city our unsuspecting hero realises that a mysterious and terrifying figure is following him.

results.title: Our peninsula
results.brief_description: A personal narrative by Jenny Macaffer about her family’s relationship with the Mornington Peninsula over three generations using photographic images and computer animation. Pipe music performed by the Rats of Tobruk Memorial Highland Band 1984.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: Me do
results.brief_description: Gabrielle recounts her struggle to gain independance, aided by the love and support of her mother and eight siblings. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.
